widgets.name: Cloud Accounts
widgets.data: Cloud Account means a unique Portal account assigned to a Cloud User, which is necessary for use of the Cloud Products, and used for purposes of management and billing associated with one or more Cloud Products.

widgets.name: Cloud Accounts Risk Management
widgets.data: Cloud Risk Management is the process of assessing, securing, and managing all kinds of risks related to Cloud computing. It includes assessment across your organizationâ€™s cloud footprint.

widgets.name: Cloud Accounts Latency
widgets.data: Cloud latency refers to the time it takes for data to travel between a user's device and the cloud server.

widgets.name: Cloud Premium Accounts
widgets.data: The Clouds PREMIUM theme is based on artistic images and is free to download and install on your computer.

widgets.name: Top 5 Namespace Specific Alerts
widgets.data: Alerting rules contain a set of conditions that outline a particular state within a cluster.

widgets.name: Workload Alerts
widgets.data: With workloads you get a single, global value that summarizes the status of all the entities in your workload.

widgets.name: Failure Alert
widgets.data: Failure detection is the process of inspecting logs and identifying all strings and patterns that indicate whether an error occurred in an application. .

widgets.name: Image 1
widgets.data: An image is a visual representation. An image can be two-dimensional, such as a drawing, painting, or photograph, or three-dimensional, such as a carving or sculpture

widgets.name: Image 2
widgets.data: An image is a visual representation. An image can be two-dimensional, such as a drawing, painting, or photograph, or three-dimensional, such as a carving or sculpture

widgets.name: Density Graph
widgets.data: In mathematics, a dense graph is a graph in which the number of edges is close to the maximal number of edges (where every pair of vertices is connected by one edge).
